title: The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson - Volume 2
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: (1st) Either publish the five ballads, such as they are, in a volume called BALLADS; in which case pray send sheets at once to Chatto and Windus.

title: The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson - Volume 1
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: If Chatto should take both, CUI DEDICARE?

title: The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson - Volume 1
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: I remember I have never formally thanked you for that hundred quid, nor in general for the introduction to Chatto and Windus, and continue to bury you in copy as if you were my private secretary.

title: The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson - Volume 1
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: I have a volume of republished essays coming out with Chatto and Windus; I wish they would come, that my wife might have the reviews to divert her.

title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: (You 've never said one word about them, from which I astutely gather you are dead set against: "he was a diplomatic man" extract from epitaph of E. L. B. "and remained on good terms with Minor Poets.") You will have to judge: one of the Gladstonian trinity of paths must be chosen, (ist) Either publish the five ballads, such as they are, in a volume called Ballads ; in which case pray send sheets at once to Chatto and Windus.

title: When winter comes to Main street,
author: Overton, Grant Martin
snippet: He is still in the business of publishing,  being one of the principal personages in the ancient and well-tried firm of Chatto & Windus, the English publishers of Swinburne and Mark Twain.

title: Retrospect of a long life from 1815 to 1883.
author: Hall, S. C.
snippet: They were collected into a volume and published, with all the original letterpress, in 1873 by Chatto and Windus, the successors of John Camden Hotten, who had communicated with me on the subject, and had asked my advice.

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: In the library of Parkcroy I found a veryinteresting volume entitled, The Choice Works ofDean Swift, published by Chatto & Windus in1876, which gives an account of his life more tohis honour than the accounts of this remarkableman that arc usually presented to the public.
